total_revenue.context: Q4 2022 revenue was $7.33 billion, up 26% year-over-year or 27% in constant currency.

Sales_Cloud.context: Sales Cloud grew 17% year-over-year, reaching a $6 billion run rate.

Service_Cloud.context: Service Cloud grew 18% year-over-year, achieving nearly $6.5 billion in revenue.

Marketing_and_Commerce_Cloud.context: Commerce and Marketing Clouds grew 25% year-over-year in the third quarter, continuing a 20-month run.

Platform_and_Other.context: Platform and Other segments, including Slack, MuleSoft, Tableau, and Acumen, grew 23.5% year-over-year.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Q4 GAAP Earnings Per Share was -$0.03.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Q4 non-GAAP Earnings Per Share was $0.84.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow for the full fiscal year was $5.3 billion, up 29% year-over-year.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow for Q4 was $404 million, up 19% year-over-year.

capital_expenditures.context: CapEx for Q4 was $166 million, contributing to free cash flow of $238 million.

ai_predictions.context: Data not provided in the Q4 2022 earnings call.

learners.context: Data not provided in the Q4 2022 earnings call.

jobs_created.context: Data not provided in the Q4 2022 earnings call.

business_revenues.context: Data not provided in the Q4 2022 earnings call.

market_position.description: Salesforce remains the #1 CRM provider by market share for the eighth year in a row.
initiatives: Maintaining leadership in CRM across sales, service, marketing, commerce, communities, integration, and app development.
Integrating Slack into the Customer 360 platform to enhance collaboration capabilities.
goals: Maintain CRM market leadership.
Enhance collaboration and communication through Slack integration.
examples: Integration of Slack to create a Slack-first Customer 360.
Continued leadership in CRM as rated by IDC and Gartner.

innovation.description: Focus on Customer 360, AI innovations, and integration of Slack.
initiatives: Enhancing Customer 360 to provide unified customer views with Slack integration.
Advancing AI capabilities with Einstein to support customer success.
Expanding Salesforce Blockchain and other innovative solutions to meet customer needs.
goals: Empower customers with AI and blockchain capabilities.
Provide unified customer experiences through integrated platforms.
Drive workforce development and ecosystem growth.
examples: Integration of Slack in the Customer 360 platform.
Slack-First Customer 360 making Salesforce products more powerful and effective.

tableau.description: Integration of Tableau into Salesforce ecosystem continues to drive data visualization and analytics capabilities.
initiatives: Leveraging Tableau in top deals to enhance business intelligence offerings.
goals: Expand data analytics offerings.
Leverage Tableau for advanced business intelligence.
examples: Tableau featured in 9 of Salesforce's top 10 deals for Q4 2022.
Integration benefits customers like MillerKnoll and RBC Wealth Management.

salesforce_org.description: Integration and support for Salesforce.org enhancing nonprofit and education sectors.
initiatives: Continuing to empower nonprofit and education customers through Salesforce.org.
goals: Support mission-driven organizations.
Strengthen corporate social responsibility initiatives.
examples: Salesforce.org continues to support over 51,000 nonprofits with free services.

clicksoftware.description: Integration of ClickSoftware to enhance field service capabilities.
initiatives: Delivering greater field service innovation through ClickSoftware integration.
goals: Expand field service offerings.
Improve customer service workflows.
examples: FOX Sports utilizing Field Service Lightning for enhanced service delivery.

vlocity.description: Integration of Vlocity to enhance industry-specific solutions.
initiatives: Delivering powerful industry-specific clouds and mobile app solutions through Vlocity.
goals: Expand industry-specific offerings.
Enhance customer success across verticals.
examples: Vlocity contributing to tailored solutions for sectors like telecommunications and healthcare.

slack.description: Acquisition and integration of Slack to enhance collaboration and communication capabilities.
initiatives: Integrating Slack with Salesforce products to create a Slack-first platform.
Building new capabilities leveraging Slack's collaboration tools.
goals: Enhance productivity for customers through integrated collaboration tools.
Expand Salesforce's presence in the enterprise communication space.
examples: Slack integrated into Salesforce's Customer 360 to enhance collaboration.
Slack's revenue accelerated to 39% growth year-over-year on a standalone basis.

traction_on_demand.description: Acquisition of Traction on Demand to enhance professional services offerings.
initiatives: Integrating Traction on Demand's professional services to support customer implementations.
goals: Enhance professional services capabilities.
Provide end-to-end customer implementation support.
examples: Traction on Demand expected to close by the end of the fiscal quarter, contributing $75 million in revenue for fiscal '23.

ecosystem_development.description: Growth of Salesforce ecosystem through Trailhead, strategic partnerships, and Slack integration.
initiatives: Expanding Trailhead to support continuous learning and reskilling.
Enhancing My Trailhead for customers to create branded learning experiences.
Strengthening strategic partnerships with global brands like IBM, Amazon, Microsoft, and Alibaba.
Integrating Slack to enhance the collaborative ecosystem.
goals: Create more than 3 million jobs and $860 billion in GDP impact worldwide by 2022.
Provide over 1 million Americans with Salesforce credentials.
Contribute to 4.2 million new jobs and $1.2 trillion in new business revenues worldwide from 2019 through 2024.
examples: Accenture leveraging My Trailhead for employee reskilling.
Telstra adopting My Trailhead.
Partnership with Alibaba to support multinational customers.
IBM building their Customer 360 on Salesforce and Slack integration.

social_initiatives.description: Enhanced support for nonprofits, commitment to sustainability, and integration of Slack.
initiatives: Supporting over 51,000 nonprofits with Salesforce.org.
Delivering $450 million in grants and 6 million volunteer hours.
Achieving net zero gas emissions globally and providing a carbon-neutral cloud to customers.
Committing to 100% renewable energy for global operations by 2022.
Integrating Slack to support collaborative and sustainable work environments.
goals: Empower nonprofit, education, and philanthropy customers to fulfill their missions.
Enhance corporate social responsibility efforts.
Reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
examples: Salesforce.org supporting 51,000 nonprofits with free services.
$450 million in grants delivered to various causes.
Carbon-neutral cloud and commitment to renewable energy initiatives.
Slack-First Customer 360 promoting sustainable collaboration.

revenue_growth.expectation: Robust organic and acquisition-driven growth with continued demand for CRM and integrated solutions.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to remain strong or accelerate in upcoming quarters.
factors: Growth in Salesforce platform and cloud services.
Successful integration of acquisitions like Slack and Traction on Demand.
Increased demand for digital transformation and customer experience solutions.

fy_2022.context: Fiscal year 2022 revenue guidance raised to $26.4 billion, representing approximately 24% growth year-over-year.

fy_2026.context: Revenue target of $50 billion by fiscal year 2026.

q4.context: Q4 revenue was $7.33 billion, up 26% year-over-year.

revenue.context: Fiscal year 2023 Q1 revenue guidance of $7.215 billion to $7.25 billion, or approximately 21% to 22% growth year-over-year.

drivers: Continued investment in AI and commercial sales capacity.

expense_outlook_excluding_accrual.note: Expense outlook essentially unchanged excluding Salesforce.org-related expenses.

core_trends: Continued investment in cloud and AI.
Strategic acquisitions to enhance product offerings.

revenue.context: Fiscal year 2022 revenue guidance raised to $26.4 billion, representing approximately 24% growth year-over-year.

operating_margin.context: Fiscal year 2022 non-GAAP operating margin raised to 18.7%, an expansion of 90 basis points year-over-year.

capex.context: Fiscal year 2022 CapEx expected to remain at approximately 3% of revenue.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year 2022 GAAP diluted EPS was $1.48.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year 2022 non-GAAP diluted EPS was $4.78.

operating_cash_flow_growth.context: Fiscal year 2022 operating cash flow guidance raised by 4 points, now expecting 18% to 19% growth year-over-year.

revenue.context: Q1 revenue guidance raised to $7.37 billion to $7.38 billion, approximately 24% growth year-over-year.

crpo_growth.context: Q1 CRPO growth of approximately 21%, including 5 points from Slack.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Q1 GAAP EPS guidance of -$0.05 to -$0.04.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Q1 non-GAAP EPS guidance of $0.93 to $0.94.

revenue.context: Fiscal year 2023 revenue guidance raised to $32.1 billion, representing approximately 21% growth year-over-year.

operating_margin.context: Fiscal year 2023 non-GAAP operating margin guidance of 20%.

capex.context: Fiscal year 2023 CapEx expected to be approximately 2% of revenue, an all-time low.

gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year 2023 GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $0.46 to $0.48.

non_gaap_diluted_eps.context: Fiscal year 2023 non-GAAP diluted EPS guidance of $4.62 to $4.64.

operating_cash_flow_growth.context: Fiscal year 2023 operating cash flow guidance initiated at approximately 21% to 22% year-over-year.

operating_environment_challenges: Integration of Slack and Traction on Demand acquisitions.
Managing FX headwinds impacting revenue growth.
Balancing investments in cloud and AI with profitability.
Adapting to competitive pressures in cloud and CRM markets.
Scaling operations to support rapid growth in key segments like Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.
Ongoing impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and geopolitical tensions on operations, customer behavior, and economic conditions.
